title: Kanye West drops new merchandise following his album release
text:
Kanye West just released his latest album Jesus Is King on Friday.

And while the new album is climbing the charts, the 42-year-old rapper made sure to drop some new merchandise for fans to celebrate. Pieces in the collection range anywhere from $13 for a vinyl all the way to $170 for sweatshirts.

Meanwhile, an Us Weekly source reveals that the Grammy winner 'can't wait to tour.'

New album alert: Kanye West's new album is climbing the charts and the rapper made sure to drop some new merchandise for fans to celebrate

Merch: Pieces in the collection range anywhere from $13 for a vinyl all the way to $170 for sweatshirts

This launch comes after a successful drop from his Sunday Service collection back in April for Coachella.

Afterwards, he filed a trademark over the summer for 'bottoms, dresses, footwear, headwear, jackets, loungewear, scarves, shirts, socks and tops.'

And according to TMZ, that request was denied due to someone else already owning the brand name.

Gospel: During his performance at the LA Forum over the weekend, West had some custom banners hanging outside

But with all of that behind him, the source went on to say that 'He is excited about his new music. He is putting together a tour schedule right now. He wants to start the tour as soon as possible.'

'He is in [a] much better place mentally than he was during his last tour,' the source continued.

The father-of-four canceled his Saint Pablo tour back in 2016 just before he was hospitalized for exhaustion.

Sunday service: The Kardashian and Jenner family joined together for the musical event

But while Kanye may be ready to hit the road, his famous reality star wife may have a few objections.

'Kim supports a tour, but still has concerns,' the source revealed. 'She doesn't want him to go crazy and do an intense tour with no breaks. She wants him to focus on his well-being and mental health too.'

Currently, West is out promoting the album and held his Sunday Service in Los Angeles where the Kardashian clan made an appearance as well as Kendall Jenner and Kris Jenner.

'I've spread a lot of things,' he said during an interview with Zane Lowe on Beats. 'There was a time I was letting you know what high fashion had done for me, I was letting you know what the Hennessy had done for me, but now I'm letting you know what Jesus has done for me, and in that I'm no longer a slave, I'm a son now, a son of God. I'm free.'
description: Kanye West just released his latest album Jesus Is King on Friday. And while the new album is climbing the charts, the 42-year-old rapper made sure to drop some new merchandise for fans to celebrate.
